objects.label: New Email Template
objects.source:
{% if content.meta_description %}{% endif %}
{% text "preview_text" label="Preview Text This will be used as the preview text that displays in some email clients", value="", no_wrapper=True %}
{% if content.create_page %}
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page here.
{% endif %}
{% logo "logo_image" overrideable=true, suppress_company_name=true, label='Logo'%}
{% content_attribute "email_body" %}

Hi {{ contact.firstname }},

Describe what you have to offer the customer. Why should they read? What did you promise them in the subject line? Tell them something cool. Make them laugh. Make them cry. Well, maybe don't do that...

Use a list to:

  • Explain the value of your offer
  • Remind the reader what they’ll get out of taking action
  • Show off your skill with bullet points
  • Make your content easy to scan

LINK TO A LANDING PAGE ON YOUR SITE (This is the really important part.)

Now wrap it all up with a pithy little reminder of how much you love them.

Aw. You silver-tongued devil, you.

Sincerely,

Your name

{% end_content_attribute %}
{% hubspot_footer %}

The thank you email does not have to be the last time you connect with a lead. Don't waste this thank you email with a short "Thanks! Bye!" message! Continue to engage your lead and nurture them further by delivering to them a genuine thank you and providing them with even more value.

You can take this opportunity to provide your lead with other ways to engage with your company. Is there anything else that your lead should know at this stage in the funnel? Can you earn more lead information with an additional ask?

Hi {{ contact.firstname }},

\n

Describe what you have to offer the customer. Why should they read? What did you promise them in the subject line? Tell them something cool. Make them laugh. Make them cry. Well, maybe don\'t do that...

\n

Use a list to:

\n
    \n
  • Explain the value of your offer
    • \n
  • Remind the reader what they’ll get out of taking action
    • \n
  • Show off your skill with bullet points
    • \n
  • Make your content easy to scan
    • \n
\n

LINK TO A LANDING PAGE ON YOUR SITE (This is the really important part.)

\n

Now wrap it all up with a pithy little reminder of how much you love them.

\n

Aw. You silver-tongued devil, you.

\n

Sincerely,

\n

Your name

Add information for your reader here. Direct your reader to complete an action, whether that is to learn more, purchase a product or download an ebook. Use this space to explain to readers why they should want to click on the button below.

\n

 

\n

Let the reader know what’s new - you might include new releases, deals, special offers, giveaways, or new projects you’re working on.

\n

 

\n
    \n
  • Showcase your best stories
    Give an overview of new blog posts or press releases. Be sure to add a link so the reader can learn more.
    • \n
\n
    \n
  • Help people get to know you
    You can share information on what’s new with your company. Do you have an upcoming event? Has there been any new additions to your team?
    • \n
\n
    \n
  • Keep the conversation going
    Tell your reader how they can get in touch if they have questions.
    • \n
\n

 

\n

Next, you should direct your reader to complete an action, whether that is to learn more, purchase a product or download an ebook. Use this space to explain to readers why they should want to click on the button below.

Hi, thank the reader for signing up to your newsletter and welcome them on board. Below your introduction, add a few links to some popular pages or posts on your website to give the reader an idea of what’s to come.

  1. Showcase your best stories
    Give an overview of an existing blog post or a popular story from a previous newsletter. Be sure to add a link so the reader can learn more.

  2. Help people get to know you
    Share a link to your website’s about us page where the reader can learn more about you and your community.

  3. Keep the conversation going
    Tell your reader how they can get in touch if they have questions.

Thanks,
The Your Company Name team

Do you still want to hear from us?

Hello,

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

\n

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

\n

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

\n

All the best,

\n

Your full name

\n

Your job title

\n

Other contact information

Welcome your reader

\n

We've put together this template for your first test email send. Each email should have an image, some text and a call-to action button.

\n

 

\n

To start with, thank the reader for signing up to your newsletter and welcome them on board. Outline the benefits of the newsletter and let customers know how often they can expect to receive it.

Hi {{ contact.firstname }},

Describe what you have to offer the customer. Why should they read? What did you promise them in the subject line? Tell them something cool. Make them laugh. Make them cry. Well, maybe don't do that...

Use a list to:

  • Show off your skill with bullet points
